summary: Motörhead was an English rock band formed in 1975 by Lemmy Kilmister and others. They are known for their heavy metal music and are considered pioneers of the genre. The band had many lineup changes, but Lemmy was the constant member. Motörhead released 23 studio albums and had several successful singles. They were famous for songs like "Ace of Spades," which talked about gambling. The band broke up after Lemmy's death in 2015. Motörhead sold over 30 million albums and is remembered as one of the greatest hard rock acts.
title: Motörhead
